summary: The concept of "equality before the law" is a fundamental principle enshrined in EU legal frameworks, emphasizing that all individuals, regardless of status, are subject to the same legal standards and protections. This principle underpins various rights and freedoms, ensuring that justice is administered impartially and without discrimination. In the context of EU regulations, it reinforces the rule of law and promotes social cohesion by guaranteeing that every citizen has equal access to legal remedies and protections. The commitment to equality before the law is pivotal in upholding democratic values and fostering trust in legal institutions across member states.
